newsitem.title: IRAN: Quake jolts southern Iran, no damages - agency.
newsitem.headline: Quake jolts southern Iran, no damages - agency.

text.p: An earthquake hit an area near the southern Iranian city of Shiraz on Monday but caused no damages or casualties, Iran's official news agency IRNA said.

The quake measured 4.8 on the Richter scale -- powerful enough to cause heavy damage in a populated area -- and struck a region 30 km (19 miles) west of Shiraz at 3.30 p.m. (1200 GMT), the agency said.
"The quake has caused no damage to life or property," IRNA said.
Iran's worst recorded quake measured 7.3 on the Richter scale and killed 35,000 people in a densely populated region near the Caspian coast in 1990.
